Pima Air and Space Museum

Design work for what would become the B-52 Stratofortress began in 1945.  After several major design changes, the first of the eight-engined bombers took to the air on October 2, 1952.  The first of the eight major production variants of the B-52 were built in 1954, with production continuing through 1963.  The fourth model of the B-52 built, the B-52D was the second most produced version of the Stratofortress.  Delivery of the “D” models began in 1956 with a total of 170 built.

As they were first built, the “D” model was virtually identical to earlier models of the aircraft except that it lacked the reconnaissance ability of earlier B-52s and was intended purely as a bomber.  In 1965, modification of B-52D aircraft began to increase their conventional bomb load.  The “Big Belly” modifications resulted in the ability to carry a total 108 conventional bombs both internally and externally.  This means that one aircraft could carry 54,000 pounds of bombs, roughly the equivalent of nine World War Two B-17s.  B-52s dropped thousands of tons of bombs on targets in Vietnam, becoming the symbol of American strategic air power during that war.

O maior educador brasileiro, reconhecido mundialmente, Paulo Freire dizia que “ensinar não é transferir conhecimento, mas criar as possibilidades para a sua própria produção ou a sua construção.” E essas possibilidades por Freire citadas se referem a diversos fatores importantes presentes no processo de educação, como o local onde se constrói o conhecimento e também as ferramentas disponíveis para tal construção. Na manhã desta terça-feira (14/12), a prefeita de Contagem, Marília Campos, visitou o Cemei Arvoredo, onde pode ver na prática o que o educador falou em seus ensinamentos. Acompanhada do vice-prefeito Ricardo Faria, da secretária de Educação, Telma Fernanda Ribeiro, da administradora Regional Ressaca, Maria José Pacheco, e da vereadora Silvinha Dudu, a comitiva foi guiada pela diretora do espaço, a professora Ana Paula Rodrigues de Souza, por uma super estrutura em termos  de qualidade e acolhedora para receber crianças de zero a 5 anos de idade.

Com um modelo moderno e funcional, o Cemei Arvoredo funciona em dois blocos. O bloco A para crianças de zero a três anos conta com duas salas amplas, com solário, estrutura de berçário, um lactário, uma lavanderia, além de refeitório, almoxarifado e sala de professores.  O bloco B, destinado aos alunos de 4 a 5 anos, é um espaço com oito salas igualmente amplas com boa ventilação, além de uma sala multiuso, que serve a creche e a pré-escola. O prédio foi construído nos mínimos detalhes pensando nas necessidades das crianças e de como ensiná-las desde pequenas a se apropriarem e aprenderem o funcionamento de equipamentos como pias para lavar as mãos, bebedouros, sanitários, áreas para banhos. Todos em “miniatura”, instalados na altura dos pequenos e pequenas, estimulando-os assim à independência e autonomia desde a infância.  A importância de todo equipamento estar na altura delas é porque “na educação infantil  todas as atividades são currículos, pois o tempo cronológico das crianças é diferenciado”. Na unidade, o respeito ainda pode ser sentido pelo pé ao pisar o piso tátil e com os espaços acessíveis, incluindo o banheiro, configurado às necessidades das crianças portadoras de alguma deficiência.

Uma novidade que trouxe tranquilidade tanto para os servidores quanto para as famílias que têm filhos atendidos na unidade é a presença 24 horas durante toda a semana dos porteiros da prestadora de serviços MGS,  que também é responsável pela limpeza.

Por causa da pandemia o Cemei Arvoredo, que tem capacidade para mais de 300 alunos e alunas, está presencialmente com apenas 114, que vão à unidade três vezes na semana com carga horária reduzida de três horas diárias. Segundo informou Ana Paula Rodrigues de Souza, o retorno gradual aconteceu em  agosto com dez turmas, sendo cinco no diurno e outras cinco no vespertino.  “Devido a pandemia, as turmas foram reduzidas, e só devem voltar ao normal, se o controle da pandemia se mantiver, com 20 turmas no total, com capacidade de atender a mais de 300 alunos e alunas no início de 2022, com  carga horária presencial de 4h30, em 200 dias letivos”. Antes do retorno parcial, as aulas estavam sendo ministradas remotamente, com o envio de material didático e atividades pelas redes sociais e mídias.

A volta total das atividades presenciais é aguardada, ansiosamente, pela dona de casa, Edna Lima de Andrade, 31 anos. Ela quer que o filho, Matheus Andrade de Souza, 2 anos, aproveite ao máximo as possibilidades do espaço. “Eu fiquei muito feliz por ter conseguido a matrícula para meu filho. Foi um momento em que me emocionei bastante. Agora, estou ansiosa pelo retorno total das atividades“, conta ela, ao destacar que o garoto está com mais energia e animado no convívio familiar após passar parte de seu tempo no Cemei.

Mais vagas, mais Cemeis

É para atender mães como Edna que a Prefeitura de Contagem está trabalhando para garantir vagas para crianças de zero a 3 anos nos Cemeis, uma vez que já contempla toda a demanda para os que têm 4 e 5 anos.

“Nosso desafio central é ampliar a oferta de educação infantil especialmente para o público  de zero a 3 anos.  Está no nosso planejamento a compra de terrenos para a construção de mais seis Cemeis. Além de um estudo para a construção de mais outras seis unidades”, adiantou a prefeita Marília Campos durante a visita.  “Estamos  conseguindo estruturar a educação infantil que é um direito das crianças e  também das mães, pois deixando os filhos aqui, elas têm como criar os outros filhos e  ainda trabalhar”, completou a chefe do Executivo.

Outro desafio, agora, apontado pela diretora do Cemei,  é se aproveitar de modo pedagógico da estrutura montada para “ colocar a criança no foco, como protagonista do projeto de ensino: cuidando dela e dando a ela todas as condições para se desenvolver de maneira completa e autônoma”.

 Segundo o vice-prefeito Ricardo Faria, a visita à unidade foi inspiradora. “De um lado vemos a forma de fazer gestão ao garantir uma escola pública de qualidade, uma escola inclusive, garantindo este direito para as crianças, para as mães, ao fornecer também o kit escolar, merenda escolar, computadores e esse suporte, em meio às dificuldades que as famílias estão vivendo por causa da pandemia, de oferecer a cesta básica. Na outra ponta a valorização dos professores, garantindo essa materialidade, o suporte tecnológico, com pacote de dados, que resulta no brilho no olhar do educador”, comentou ele ao afirmar a satisfação que sentiu ao perceber nos trabalhadores a alegria de compartilhar este momento.

Cestas Básicas, uma ajuda em meio a pandemia

Desde o dia 3 de dezembro, as famílias que têm filhos na Rede Municipal de Ensino, Rede Parceira e Fundação de Ensino de Contagem – Funec  estão recebendo da Prefeitura de Contagem cestas básicas para os estudantes. Cada família ganha o número de cestas de acordo com a quantidade de filhos matriculados na rede de ensino. O auxílio vem para as famílias contagenses em mais uma ação, desta vez resguardando a segurança alimentar e nutricional das famílias que vivenciaram mais um  ano marcado pelas dificuldades impostas pela  pandemia da Covid-19. Ao todo serão entregues 65 mil cestas básicas, com um investimento de R$87,29 por unidade, somando, aproximadamente, R$5,7 milhões.

Um ano novo de melhorias

Durante a visita, a prefeita Marília Campos ainda afirmou aos professores a valorização da classe a partir de 2022, quando o município ficará livre da Lei Federal 173 que proíbe o aumento dos gastos com pessoal dos entes federados. “Estamos programando para melhorar a situação dos servidores e educadores”.

Já no primeiro semestre, a secretária de Educação, Telma Fernanda Ribeiro, informou que os professores da rede municipal passarão por uma formação promovida em parceria com a Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais – UFMG, contemplando as áreas de educação infantil, integral e de jovens e adultos.

Mesmo diante de todos os desafios impostos pela pandemia, 2021 ficará marcado por melhorias nas condições de ensino para alunos e trabalhadores da rede municipal. Segundo a secretaria de Educação, foram locados computadores para 50% dos professores dos ensinos infantil e fundamental, sendo contemplados 100% dos professores da Educação de Jovens e Adultos – EJA. Cada escola receberá 20 notebooks para formar seus laboratórios de informática. Também foram adquiridos chips com pacotes de dados para todos os professores da rede, assim como  tablets. Estes serão distribuídos, no próximo ano, após a realização de um diagnóstico sobre a necessidade do equipamento para estudantes que tiveram ou ainda têm problemas com a internet. “Essas aquisições vêm como resultado de um diagnóstico que revelou os problemas existentes com a materialidade”, frisou Ribeiro.

description:
Fotos: Janine Moraes/PMC

Em reunião realizada no saguão da Prefeitura de Contagem, nesta quinta-feira (18/11), empreendedores da Feira do Eldorado estabeleceram junto à gestão municipal as diretrizes para realocação do empreendimento. Representantes de todos os segmentos da feira aproveitaram para apresentar as demandas de cada setor e reafirmaram a parceria com o poder público.

Estiveram presentes na reunião a prefeita Marília Campos; o vice-prefeito, Ricardo Faria; o presidente da Câmara Municipal, vereador Alex Chiodi; o secretário de Administração, Pedro Amaral; o presidente da Transcon, Renato Ribeiro; e o administrador da Regional Eldorado, Gil Martins. O encontro contou ainda com dez representantes de cada setor da feira.

Os feirantes tiveram a oportunidade de expressar suas dificuldades e trazer as demandas dos setores, como a distribuição e organização das barracas, a possibilidade de uso de mesas e cadeiras para os comerciantes de alimentos, cobertura da área, entre outros. Ficou determinado que um relatório será feito pontuando cada melhoria solicitada, a fim de avaliar o que é viável fazer, considerando a estrutura do novo local.

A feira, que estava sendo realizada na avenida João César de Oliveira, voltará a ser alocada na avenida José Faria da Rocha e nas ruas Inglaterra e Norberto Mayer. No mês de dezembro, haverá feiras extras no Natal e no Réveillon. As feiras ocorrerão  de 22 a 24 e dias 30 e 31, e servirão de teste para o novo local.

O administrador da Regional Eldorado, Gil Martins, saiu satisfeito da reunião e explicou quais são as próximas etapas. “Reunimos com a comissão paritária uma vez por mês e esta foi uma reunião ampliada por solicitação da Prefeitura, que queria conversar com todos os feirantes. O próximo passo agora é dar encaminhamento a essas deliberações feitas hoje. Vamos fazer o processo de medição da rua onde ficam as barracas e chamar todos os setores para definir onde cada um vai ficar”, esclareceu.

A prefeita Marília Campos explicou que não será possível realizar a feira na avenida João César de Oliveira por conta das obras do Sistema Integrado de Mobilidade – SIM que estão em andamento. Quando ela for concluída, a dinâmica do trânsito no local impedirá a permanência do grande fluxo de pessoas provocado pela feira. A chefe do Executivo pediu para que os feirantes se unam para construir junto ao Poder Público a melhor solução para que a feira siga fortalecida.

“É muito importante que os representantes de cada segmento ajude a encontrar a melhor solução. Da parte da Prefeitura, os feirantes terão o apoio necessário para debater, para construir de forma coletiva a forma ideal de fortalecer essa atividade econômica e cultural. Essa reunião mostra que estamos abertos ao diálogo, que aqui é um espaço de debate que deve ser utilizado. Se todos derem as mãos, encontraremos a solução”, declarou.

Sanar os gargalos enfrentados pelos comerciantes e impulsionar a feira é uma meta para a gestão, que tem priorizado encontrar soluções para os feirantes. “O que estamos fazendo em Contagem é ampliar as feiras, levando para todos os territórios, porque sabemos o que a pandemia causou nas famílias que dependem delas. Estamos estimulando a economia solidária e vamos fortalecer a feira também, mas precisamos de muito diálogo para alcançar a solução que beneficie a todos”, concluiu.

Atualmente, a Feira do Eldorado conta com 874 feirantes cadastrados, distribuídos na comercialização de vestuário adulto, infantil, alimentação, decoração, artesanato, couro e hortifruti.

A Mídia NINJA realizou uma cobertura especial da COP 26 em Glasgow.  Mobilizamos redes de ativismos em uma ação colaborativa envolvendo povos indígenas, mulheres, LGBT+s e jovens de periferia urbana de diferentes países. Trabalhamos para contar histórias com foco em Justiça social e climática, a partir de uma pluralidade de vozes do Sul Global, e cobramos de autoridades e governos ações imediatas e urgentes diante da crise ambiental e pela promoção de uma transição justa e rápida.

Em parceria com a COP26 Coalition, ocupamos as ruas e as redes. Organizamos uma cobertura colaborativa das marchas e da People's Summit fortalecendo as narrativas da luta por Justiça Climática.

Foto: Oliver Kornblihtt / Mídia NINJA / #COPCollab26

A fim de diminuir os efeitos causados pela alta demanda por atendimento para casos de síndrome gripal nas Unidades de Pronto Atendimento-UPAs, Unidades Básicas de Saúde-UBSs e no Pronto Atendimento Pediátrico do Centro Materno Infantil de Contagem, percebido nas duas últimas semanas, a Prefeitura de Contagem vem buscando estratégias para diminuir o tempo de espera e a superlotação das unidades.

De acordo com prefeita Marília Campos, a administração vem seguindo diretrizes na busca pela comodidade e conforto para quem usa o serviço público para cuidar da saúde. “Temos enfrentado um surto de síndrome gripal e, com intuito de minimizar os efeitos, vamos ampliar o atendimento em seis Unidades Básicas de Saúde até às 20h e contratar profissionais para adequarmos o atendimento das UPAs a esse novo momento que estamos vivendo. Além disso, as escalas médicas das UPAs vêm sendo reforçadas com o objetivo de agilizar o atendimento dos pacientes”.

Tais medidas estão valendo a partir desta terça-feira (28/12) e, segundo o secretário de Saúde, Fabrício Simões, inicialmente, a ampliação do horário das UBSs será por uma semana, podendo ser estendida, caso seja necessário.

As ações foram anunciadas durante a visita da prefeita e do secretário, na manhã desta terça-feira, à UPA JK. Na oportunidade, eles conversaram com médicos, funcionários e pacientes para averiguar as necessidades recorrentes no local. A maior parte das pessoas relatou problemas com tempo de atendimento e grande fluxo de pessoas.

Em resposta, a prefeita Marília Campos lembrou que muitos usuários não vão às UBSs por causa do horário ou mesmo por acharem que estão com algo mais grave, salientou a importância da extensão do horário, bem como do fato das pessoas recorrerem primeiro às UBSs em caso de sintomas leves. “Aumentaremos o horário de atendimento nesta semana, pois as Unidades Básicas de Saúde são os locais que fazem esse primeiro atendimento. No caso de ser algo mais grave, as próprias unidades encaminham as pessoas para as UPAs, que darão o suporte. É importante esse fluxo até para evitar atraso em atendimentos e sobrecarga em determinados equipamentos”, ressaltou.

A chefe do Executivo lembrou que a Prefeitura está tomando as medidas necessárias para melhorar a assistência, mas pediu que a população colabore, buscando os locais adequados para atendimento de acordo com a situação, ressaltando que somente na UPA JK são mais de 10 mil atendimentos por mês, com pessoas não apenas de Contagem, mas de toda a Região Metropolitana.

Desafios e direcionamentos

O Centro de Informações Estratégicas em Vigilância em Saúde de Contagem-Cievs emitiu o segundo alerta de risco, no último dia 16 de dezembro, para as unidades, quanto ao aumento do registro de casos de síndrome gripal. Em Contagem, o aumento nos atendimentos por causa de síndromes gripais é de cerca de 30%.

Muito do atraso no atendimento se deve ao maior fluxo de pessoas que têm procurado as UPAs, principalmente, com problemas respiratórios leves. A Secretaria Municipal de Saúde orienta que a população procure estas unidades de urgência e emergência apenas para sintomas moderados ou graves. Para os casos leves, as pessoas devem procurar a Unidade Básica de Saúde – UBS mais próxima da residência.

De acordo com a médica Ângela Deise, atualmente, Contagem passa por um momento de aumento de casos de gripe, que possui sintomas parecidos com os da Covid-19. “Num primeiro momento, por causa de febre, dificuldade de alimentação, falta de ar, muita gente acredita que estar com Covid-19 e acabam procurando a UPA. Chegam, fazem o teste e não sendo constatado a contaminação pandêmica, damos um direcionamento adequado ao tratamento individualizado”, contou.

A superintendente das UPAs do Serviço Social Autônomo-SSA de Contagem, Beatriz Palhares, reforçou a necessidade do paciente buscar o atendimento no local próprio para cada situação. “Somente na UPA JK, nossa média de atendimentos diária é de 260 e passamos para mais de 400, nos últimos dias. Ontem (27/12), foram 485, sendo a maioria com síndrome gripal. Pedimos, assim, que, primeiramente, as pessoas procurem as UBSs, que possuem médicos, enfermeiros e técnicos, para esse primeiro atendimento e, se for um caso mais complexo, serão encaminhados para as UPAs ou seja remanejados pelo próprio equipamento básico. Assim vamos conseguir melhorar o processo, o atendimento e reduzir o tempo de espera”, explicou.

description: Virginia National Guard Soldiers assigned to 1st Battalion, 111th Field Artillery Regiment, 116th Infantry Brigade Combat Team conduct pre-aim calibration test firing on the Counter-Rocket, Artillery, Mortar Intercept Land-based Phalanx Weapon System Feb. 6, 2022, at Fort Sill, Oklahoma. C-RAM is a set of systems used to detect and/or destroy incoming rockets, artillery and mortar rounds in the air before they hit their ground targets, and the VNG Soldiers are on federal active duty preparing to deploy to the Central Command area of operations in the Middle East to provide personnel and site protection. The pre-aim calibration test makes sure C-RAM radars are aligned with the guns and see everything the radars see so they can hit their intended target. Soldiers have trained on how load and operate the systems as well as function in the engagement operations center that controls direct fire engagements against suspected targets.  (U.S. National Guard photo by Cotton Puryear)

People´s Summit • COP 26 Coalition

Cúpula dos Povos por Justiça Climática

A Mídia NINJA realizou uma cobertura especial da COP 26 em Glasgow.  Mobilizamos redes de ativismos em uma ação colaborativa envolvendo povos indígenas, mulheres, LGBT+s e jovens de periferia urbana de diferentes países. Trabalhamos para contar histórias com foco em Justiça social e climática, a partir de uma pluralidade de vozes do Sul Global, e cobramos de autoridades e governos ações imediatas e urgentes diante da crise ambiental e pela promoção de uma transição justa e rápida.

Em parceria com a #COP26Coalition, ocupamos as ruas e as redes. Organizamos uma cobertura colaborativa das marchas e da People's Summit fortalecendo as narrativas da luta por Justiça Climática.

Foto: Oliver Kornblihtt / Mídia NINJA / #COPCollab26

description: Viaduto Duca Serra -31-01-22

Pleomorphic structures found in pure cultures of Dermatophilus congolensis. Cocci, rod like structures and the familiar parallel lines of zoospores (tram tracks) are all present. This slide was prepared with an unknown stain.

This is an image of a microscope slide that is part of a collection of teaching materials in the Department of Veterinary Microbiology at the University of Saskatchewan. These slides were prepared by a number of unattributed instructors from the 1960's through the early 2000's; this photo was taken by Joseph E. Rubin in early 2022.

Gram-stain of a pure culture of Moraxella sp. Note the Gram-negative cocci, often present in pairs (diplococci) or tetrads.

This is an image of a microscope slide that is part of a collection of teaching materials in the Department of Veterinary Microbiology at the University of Saskatchewan. Virginia National Guard Soldiers assigned to the Hampton-based Bravo Battery, 1st Battalion, 111th Field Artillery Regiment, 116th Infantry Brigade Combat Team represent the modern military and conduct a blank-fire demonstration with a M119A3 howitzer at Jamestown Settlement’s Military Through the Ages March 19, 2022, at Jamestown, Virginia. The Soldiers talked with visitors, answered questions about artillery capabilities and took part in a demonstration representing more than 400 years of artillery. Maj. Gen. Timothy P. Williams, the Adjutant General of Virginia, visited the Soldiers and presented his challenge coin as a thanks to the Soldiers for representing the VNG at the event. Soldiers assigned to the 1-111th are also currently on federal active duty in Iraq, and you can read more about their mission at go.usa.gov/xzECU. Read about the VNG’s historical connection to Jamestown at go.usa.gov/xzpjn. (U.S. National Guard photo by Cotton Puryear)

Pima Air and Space Museum

90-mm M2A1 Anti-Aircraft and Anti-Tank Gun
SERIAL NUMBER 1559

In 1938 the U.S. Army Coast Artillery Board asked for a new anti-aircraft gun to replace their obsolete 3-inch guns. They selected the M1 90-mm anti-aircraft gun. The M1 went into service in 1940 on a platform with four foldable outriggers and a wheel carriage for towing. In 1941 the updated M1A1 went into service. The M1A1 could be controlled remotely from a director and had a higher rate of fire. The M1A1 became the Army's standard anti-aircraft gun during World War II.

Early in the war the United States military wanted a dual-purpose gun that could be used against aircraft, tanks, and boats. In May of 1943 the M2 went into service. The M2 could depress as low as -10 degrees allowing it hit ground and sea targets. Crew protection was added with a folding armor shield. Also added was the M20 fuse setter and rammer which increased the firing rate to 27 rounds per minute. M2s continued in service throughout the Korean War

Technical Specifications
Caliber: 90 mm (3.5 in)
Shell Weight: 24 lbs.
Elevation: -10 degrees to +80 degrees
Traverse: 360 degrees
Rate of Fire: 27 rounds per minute
Muzzle Velocity: 2,700 feet per second

I flew into LAX at the end of March 2022 to attend WonderCon in Anaheim. I came down early to do some plane watching and aviation photography. Because of the insane price of rental cars and gas I opted to stay at the H Hotel, famous for their 12th floor terrace. Air traffic definitely has picked up since my last visit. A lot of heavies were active and international traffic seems back to normal. About the only negatives were very few special liveries and the same murky, gray, blah sky that always happens when I'm there. Oh well, maybe next time!

I took these photos at the end of March 2022 at LAX.

Ato realizando na Medborgarplatsen em Estocolmo contra o novo orçamento azul-marrom da Suécia, que é um desastre para o clima, a igualdade e o anti-racismo. Apesar da aguda crise climática, os investimentos ambientais estão sendo abatidos por vários bilhões. O imposto é reduzido sobre os combustíveis fósseis. A devastação de nossas últimas florestas continua. Pela primeira vez na história da Suécia, o orçamento do estado foi produzido por um partido com raízes no nazismo.

Indian Encampment - 1862 Albert Bierstadt (1830 - 1902) Albert Bierstadt encountered many Plains tribes on his first journey west in 1859. This painting, completed later in his New York studio, is not a scene he witnessed firsthand, but rather one created from his imagination and informed by cultural attitudes of the mid-nineteenth century. This type of image of Plains Indians bathed in sunset was so widespread that it conveyed a misconception that American Indians were a vanishing race—an erroneous belief that continues today. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This World Class attraction was everything we expected and more. Construction has just begun on a major expansion, but that has been managed in such a way that it does not in any way detract from the experience now. This album focuses on the artwork inside the buildings and on the other interior spaces including the Eleven Restaurant and the Gift Shop. A separate album posted a few days ago is devoted to the two April mornings that we spent exploring just some of the trails that crisscross the 120 acres of Arkansas forest around the museum. Alice Walton and her co-creative team can be proud of the vision and execution of everything on this 120 acre site. _____________________________________________ "Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art is a museum of American art in Bentonville, Arkansas. The museum, founded by Alice Walton and designed by Moshe Safdie, officially opened on 11 November 2011. It offers free public admission. Alice Walton, the daughter of Walmart founder Sam Walton, spearheaded the Walton Family Foundation's involvement in developing Crystal Bridges. The museum's glass-and-wood design by architect Moshe Safdie and engineer Buro Happold features a series of pavilions nestled around two creek-fed ponds and forest trails. The 217,000 square feet complex includes galleries, several meeting and classroom spaces, a library, a sculpture garden, a museum store designed by architect Marlon Blackwell, a restaurant and coffee bar, named Eleven after the day the museum opened, "11/11/11". Crystal Bridges also features a gathering space that can accommodate up to 300 people. Additionally, there are outdoor areas for concerts and public events, as well as extensive nature trails. It employs approximately 300 people, and is within walking distance of downtown Bentonville." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crystal_Bridges_Museum_of_American_Art crystalbridges.org/nature-trails/ crystalbridges.org ...

. www.huntermuseum.org The Hunter Museum of American Art is an art museum in Chattanooga, Tennessee. The museum's collections include works representing the Hudson River School, 19th century genre painting, American Impressionism, the Ashcan School, early modernism, regionalism, and post-World War II modern and contemporary art. The building itself represents three distinct architectural stages: the original 1904 classical revival mansion designed by Abram Garfield, the son of president James A. Garfield, which has housed the museum since its opening in 1952, a brutalist addition built in 1975, and a 2005 addition designed by Randall Stout which now serves as the entrance to the museum. The museum is situated on an 80-foot (24 m) bluff overlooking the Tennessee River and downtown Chattanooga. The Faxon House, built in 1904, was built where a Confederate battery had been emplaced. Once a prestigious address for Victorian houses, the area is now home to the Bluff View Art District. The museum sits on a bluff that overlooks the Walnut Street Bridge. The Ruth S. and A. William Holmberg Pedestrian Bridge provides a pedestrian-friendly connection to the nearby Walnut Street Bridge and riverfront attractions. The Hunter Museum is named after George Hunter, who inherited the Coca-Cola Bottling empire from his uncle Benjamin Thomas. Thomas was one of the entrepreneurs who created Chattanooga's Coca-Cola bottling empire. Their nephew, George Hunter, later joined Anne Thomas to create a philanthropic organization in Hunter's memory named the Benwood Foundation. The foundation's mission was to "promote religious, charitable, scientific, literary and educational activities for the advancement or well being of mankind". The centerpiece of the Benwood Foundation's gifts to the community of Chattanooga is the Hunter Museum of American Art, originally known as the Ross Faxon House. In 2002 the Hunter Museum of American Art partnered with the City of Chattanooga, the Tennessee Aquarium and the Creative Discovery Museum to finish the 21st Century Waterfront Plan. The Hunter Museum portion of the project included a $22 million expansion and renovation, designed by Randall Stout that was completed in 2005. The project included 28,000 square feet of new construction, 34,000 square feet of renovation, a new entrance, a temporary exhibition space, restoration of the mansion, the creation of an outdoor sculpture and a complete reinstallation of the Museum's permanent collection. The Hunter Museum of American Art includes 100 years of architectures and the most complete collection of American art in the Southeast. The museum also travels nationally for exhibits and curated shows. The collection spans from the colonial period to present day and covers a wide variety of media including painting, sculpture, contemporary studio glass, and crafts. In 2006 the museum received national recognition from the Innovative Design in Engineering and Architecture with Structural Steels awards program. The award recognizes outstanding achievements in engineering and architecture on structural steel projects around the country. The Hunter Museum project earned Merit Award recognition in the category of Projects $15–$75 million. In June 2015, the Hunter Museum of Art announced on their official website that they had chosen a new executive director, Virginia Ann Sharber. . www.tnvacation.com/local/chattanooga-hunter-museum-americ... .....

description:
Temps de Flors 2022, Girona.

Girona, Temps de Flors es una exposición de flores que se celebra en la ciudad de Girona desde 1954. Girona, Temps de Flors is an exhibition of flowers that has been held in the city of Girona since 1954. Its creator was Maria Cobarsí and it was in that year that, together with some women from the Feminine Section of the Phalange, they set up the First exposure Since 1956, every month of May, this spring festival is celebrated that attracts people from all over the world.

FRESHWATER AIRCRAFT CARRIERS
UNITED STATES 1943-1945
Built in the early 20th century, the Seeandbee and the Greater Buffalo were side-paddlewheel passenger steamliners used to ferry people and goods across the Great Lakes in the northern United States. During World War II the US Navy had a need for safe environment away from enemy submarines to train naval aviators in carrier operations. To meet this need both the Seeandbee and the Greater Buffalo were converted to the Freshwater Training Aircraft Carriers USS Wolverine and USS Sable for use on Lake Michigan. They had no hangar deck below the flight deck, aircraft elevators, or support facilities and were designated as miscellaneous-unclassified ships (IX). All aircraft were flown aboard each day from naval shore bases around the Great Lakes. By the end of the war both carriers trained close 18,000 pilots with an estimated 116,000 carrier landings.


USS Wolverine IX-64:
Keel laid/built 1913 as the Seeandbee
Acquired by the US Navy in 1942
Completed as an aircraft carrier in 1942
Scrapped in 1947
Displacement: 7,200 tons
Length: 500 feet
Speed: 18 knots

USS Sable IX-81:
Keel laid/built 1924 as the Greater Buffalo
Acquired by the US Navy in 1942
Completed as an aircraft carrier in 1943
Scrapped in 1948
Displacement: 8,000 tons
Length: 535 feet
Speed: 18 knots


USS WOLVERINE & GENERAL MOTORS FM-2 WILDCAT
(BuNo 16161)
On April 12, 1945 just after 10:00AM, an FM-2 Wildcat (BuNo 16161) departed Glenview Naval Air Station, piloted by Ensign Robert L. Woodruff. He flew out over Lake Michigan to rendezvous with the training carrier USS Wolverine where he was to make the landings and takeoffs necessary to qualify to fly fighters from an aircraft carrier. Thirty minutes later at 10:40 AM, Ensign Woodruff made a landing approach to the Wolverine. Just before he reached the deck, the Landing Signal Officer noted he was too low and waved him off. Unfortunately, the plane touched down on the deck just as Woodruff applied power to go around. The tail hook caught one of the arresting wires and the plane was dragged down to the deck and over the port side of the ship into the water. Ensign Woodruff was not hurt and was returned to Glenview for more practice. The Wildcat sank into the lake and lay on the bottom for over 50 years. In the mid-1990s, the US Navy recovered several aircraft lost in training accidents from Lake Michigan. This particular plane was traded to the Military Aircraft Restoration Corporation and is now on display here at the Pima Air and Space Museum.

Pima Air and Space Museum

The Gloster Meteor was developed during World War II and was the only jet fighter to see operational service with the Allied Forces during the war. Development of the Meteor began in 1940 with the first flights in 1943. By the middle of 1944 a small number of Meteors were operational with the RAF’s Number 6 Squadron. They were used to intercept the German V-1 flying bombs and at least 14 Buzz Bombs were shot down by Meteors. Development of the Meteor continued after World War II and later versions of the aircraft served with the RAF until 1962.

The two seat Meteor T.7 trainer was introduced in 1948.  Over 700 were built for the RAF, Royal Navy and seven foreign customers. Several two seat Meteors have been modified to serve as aerial test platforms for ejection seat testing. A modified canopy allows the rear seat to be ejected in flight to test new seat designs. At least two of these aircraft are still in use by the Martin Baker company in 2019.

The F-5 was developed in conjunction with the T-38 Talon trainer as a private venture of the Northrop company. The U.S. Government selected it in 1962 for production as an export fighter for countries participating in the Military Assistance Program.  In 1970 the U.S. Air Force issued a request for proposals for a replacement for the F-5A and B. The competition was won by Northrop with an upgraded version of the F-5. The new version featured upgraded avionics, more powerful engines, a longer fuselage and larger wings all of which gave the plane a significantly improved performance. The single seat version was designated F-5E and the two-seat version was the F-5F. They also received the new name Tiger II. The F-5E and F were widely exported and several countries continue to use them. The U.S. Air Force, Navy and Marines have all used the F-5E and F-5F as Aggressor aircraft teaching military pilots the fundamentals of air-to-air combat.

Historic 1924 East Hall (East Dormitory) on the campus of Vanderbilt University in Nashville, Tennessee.  The Classical Revival style building is now called East House and is one of ten dormitories (houses) on The Martha Rivers Ingram Commons (a residential campus for all first-year students).

Peabody College originated in 1785 as Davidson Academy.  The school changed names and was reorganized numerous times - moved to downtown Nashville as Cumberland College in 1806, became the University of Nashville in 1827, began operating as a state normal school in 1875, became Peabody Normal College in 1889, became the George Peabody College for Teachers in 1909, relocated to a new campus next to Vanderbilt University in 1911 and finally became part of Vanderbilt University in 1979. The old Peabody College campus now houses Vanderbilt’s Peabody College of Education and Human Development.

Peabody College was designated as a National Historic Landmark in 1965 and listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1966 (NRHP No. 66000723).

Für Sonntag 19. Juni 2022 rief die Gruppe „Rote Linie Saarbrücken“ erneut zu einer Demonstration gegen Coronamaßnahmen in Saarbrücken auf. Nur noch rund 250 Teilnehmende fanden sich dafür trotz bestem Wetter auf dem Landwehrplatz ein. Zu Spitzenzeiten konnten hier über 5.000 Menschen mobilisiert werden. An der sinkenden Zahl konnte weder die geladene Szeneprominenz, noch die aus Rheinland-Pfalz, Baden-Württemberg und Luxemburg angereiste Unterstützung etwas ändern.

Die Auftaktkundgebung startete mit einem Bühnenprogramm von Björn Winter, alias „Björn Banane“, und dem Thüringer „Busfahrer Thomas“ Brauner, die mit Playback-Songs versuchten die nicht vorhandene Masse der als „Großdemonstration“ angekündigten Veranstaltung anzuheizen. Von der Bühne wurden diverse verschwörungsideologische Narrative verbreitet. Redner Wolfgang Greulich drohte Journalist*innen mit Klage, sollte ihm die Berichterstattung über seine Rede nicht zusagen. Im Anschluss an die Kundgebung zog der Demonstrationszug durch die Saarbrücker Innenstadt. Angeführt wurde der Marsch von den „Trommlern aus Pforzheim“, die auf ihrer Tour nach Berlin zuvor bereits zu Demonstrationen in anderen Städten angetreten sind. Abgeschlossen wurde die Versammlung auf dem Landwehrplatz mit Musikbeiträgen des Sulzbacher Liedermachers und Maßnahmengegners Guy Dawson.

Etwa ein halbes Dutzend Personen versammelte sich zu einem Gegenprotest auf dem Gustav-Regler-Platz. Aufgerufen dazu hatte die Partei „DIE PARTEI“ unter dem Motto „Mahnwache gegen absurde Demonstrationen verwirrter Spaziergänger:innen mit zuviel Tagesfreizeit“.

A spaceship has reached it's destination after calamitous difficulties and the remaining crew have to train for the landing, and indeed, compete for a place on the only viable shuttle down! The remainder will have to stay aboard, which it soon transpires will be a death sentence!

Quite a quick read, with the remaining crew both looked after and also threatened by the increasingly off-kilter AIs running the ship. Some systems try to help as normal but others try to kill them! Training sessions on how to survive become ever more convoluted, with speeded up game play of all sorts of responses to the deadly envirnment they find they have to try to occupy!
Good fun, although maybe it went on a bit too long...

Oklahoma City, Oklahoma

The Oklahoma Fallen and Living Firefighters Memorial, Just Another Day, honors all Oklahoma firefighters who have served our citizens since the inception of the Oklahoma State Firefighters Association in 1894. It was sculpted by artist Shahla Rahimi Reynolds of Oklahoma City.

Recognizing Oklahoma Firefighters
Firefighter names are inscribed in granite and those firefighters who gave the supreme sacrifice have the special and most honored space reserved at the park - The Wall of Valor. The Memorial is unique in that all Oklahoma firefighters who have served their communities for more than 20 years on an OSFA-member department or retired through disability are recognized.

description: Another day taking in the sights, smells, and tastes of London. Beautiful brisk day for wandering aimlessly. I started at Tower Hill, crossed the Thames, and just kept on going. It's always sad knowing my time in London was coming to a close for this trip. Hopefully the next trip isn't that far away. I took these photos in mid-May 2022.
Diefenbunker: Canada's Cold War Museum
Foto: Pedro Souza / Atlético

My London trip was coming to an end so I wanted to spend some time at the Myrtle Avenue field. Forecast was for excellent weather. Sunrise was shortly after 5 a.m. so I got an early start and got to the field around 5:15 - and people were there already! The bad thing was the sun rose almost directly behind the landing aircraft. We went en masse to Hatton Cross Underground Station and found some better angles. After a bit the sun got higher and was less harsh so we went back to the field. Beautiful day just sitting there watching life go by - until I fell asleep in my chair. I decided to return to my room for a proper nap. I regret that now since a bunch of cool planes landed and I would rather have shot them outdoors. Hopefully there will be a next time soon.

I took these photos in mid-May 2022.

Plot 131: Plot 133: Samuel Howard Ellis (59) 1949 – Solicitor – at Misericordiae Hospital ALEC ELLIS born June 7th 1903 accidentally killed July 1920. Per Angusta ad Augusta In Loving Memory of SAMUEL HOWARD ELLIS M.B.E. Knight Bachelor born 1889 – died 1949 husband of Ellen. father of John and Susan. He loved his family and he helped his fellow men DEATH OF SIR HOWARD ELLIS M.B.E. PROMINENT SUVA RESIDENT WELL-KNOWN IN CAMBRIDGE Sir Howard Ellis, M.B.E., of Suva, Fiji, died at the Mater Hospital, Auckland, on Wednesday. He had not been in good health for some time. Sir Howard was born at Waipu, North Auckland, in 1889, being a son of the late Mr Howard J. S. Ellis, headmaster of the Waipu School and at one time prior to that on the staff of the Cambridge School. He was educated at the Auckland Grammar School and graduated B.A. and L.L.B., from Auckland University College. He was called to the Fiji Bar in 1912; but left to serve in the 1914-18 War, first in the Northumberland Fusiliers and later in one of the earliest squadrons of the Royal Flying Corps. Shot down over France in 1916, he was a prisoner of war until exchanged in 1918, when he re-enlisted to serve again with the Royal Air Force in the defence of London. At this time he was awarded the M.B.E. Sir Howard was married in London to Mary, younger daughter of Sir Thomas Mackenzie, then New Zealand High Commissioner; she died in 1924. Returning to Suva, he recommenced his practice and took an active part in the life of the Colony, as a member of the Executive Council, as a director of several companies, and as Legal Adviser to the Diocese of Polynesia. He was a keen player of cricket, tennis and squash racquets, and he also took a great interest in all other sport. In 1926, he married Nell, a daughter of Mr Alexander Joske, of Suva. During World War II, he served on the War Council of the Governor of Fiji, Sir Phillip Mitchell, and in 1942 he undertook the arduous work of Director of Manpower and Controller of National Service. For this he was Knighted in 1942. In recent years, he spent much of his time at Cambridge. He is survived by Lady Ellis, a son and daughter, Mr John Ellis and Miss Susan Ellis, both of whom are attending the Auckland University College. paperspast.natlib.govt.nz/newspapers/WAIKIN19490121.2.10 More on Sir Howard Ellis www.cambridgeairforce.org.nz/Howard Ellis.htm clan-mackenzie-nz.wildapricot.org/page-18149 Also noted on this side of this family grave is Sir Howard's brother, Alec (buried in plot 132), who fell from a train and under a carriage.

These unusual limestone formations that grace the shores of Mono Lake are known as tufa. Tufa towers are beautiful, and they are also important habitat, from nesting sites for osprey and owls to underwater habitat for alkali flies. Many of the tufa towers in this area were formerly under water, but now stand on dry land. South Tufa Trail, Mono Lake, CA
